title: How to feed your soil in autumn for better veg in spring
text:
Healthy soil leads to healthy veg and, as we swing into autumn, it’s time to enrich your plot for 2020. Adding organic matter soon – compost or well-rotted manure – gives friendly soil organisms time to work their magic and incorporate the good stuff over the winter.

First it helps to understand your soil type and texture, be it clay, sand or loam. For a simple test, grab a handful of damp soil and squish it into a ribbon as you would Play-Doh. If you can form a 10cm+ ribbon it’s clay, water-retentive with a tendency to turn rock solid when dry. Sandy soils fall apart without forming a ribbon at all, leaching nutrients and water faster. Loam soils are a halfway house, forming a short ribbon...
